security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation with code examples. No executable code, network calls, or file system operations are present. It's a pure documentation guide for developers.

content.user_title: Build Interactive Workflow Nodes for FastGPT
content.value_statement: FastGPT workflows need interactive nodes that pause for user input. This guide provides complete documentation for developing custom interactive nodes with proper architecture and implementation steps.
actual_capabilities: Provides complete architecture documentation for interactive nodes
Includes step-by-step implementation guide with code examples
Covers both backend dispatch logic and frontend components
Documents TypeScript type definitions and constants
Explains workflow execution flow and state management
limitations: Documentation only - no automated code generation
Assumes TypeScript and React development experience
Specific to FastGPT workflow system architecture

use_cases.title: Implement custom interactive nodes
use_cases.description: Create new workflow nodes that pause execution and wait for user input before continuing the flow.

use_cases.title: Build interactive UI components
use_cases.description: Develop React components that render interactive forms and handle user input in chat interfaces.

use_cases.title: Extend workflow capabilities
use_cases.description: Add specialized interactive nodes for specific business requirements like approvals or data collection.

prompt_templates.title: Create user selection node
prompt_templates.scenario: Build a node that presents multiple choices to users
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create an interactive node that lets users select from a list of options. Show me the complete implementation including TypeScript types, dispatch logic, and React component.

prompt_templates.title: Implement form input node
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a multi-field form for user data collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me build a form input interactive node that collects multiple pieces of information from users with validation and custom field types.

prompt_templates.title: Add internationalization
prompt_templates.scenario: Support multiple languages in interactive nodes
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to add proper i18n support to my interactive node, including all required language files and translation keys.

prompt_templates.title: Debug workflow execution
prompt_templates.prompt: My interactive node is executing twice and not resuming properly. Help me identify the issue with isEntry flag management and history rewriting.

output_examples.input: Show me a complete example of creating a custom interactive node for user approval
output: Step 3: Build React component in InteractiveComponents.tsx
Step 4: Register node in constants and add to isEntry whitelist
Step 5: Add translations to language files
Result: A fully functional approval node that pauses workflow for user confirmation

best_practices: Always reset isEntry flag to false after processing user input to prevent infinite loops
Use proper TypeScript types for all node parameters and responses to ensure type safety
Test both single and chained interactive nodes to verify workflow continuation works correctly
anti_patterns: Don't forget to add your node type to the isEntry whitelist in dispatch/index.ts
Avoid parsing user input without proper error handling - always wrap JSON.parse in try-catch
Don't skip adding translations - incomplete i18n support creates poor user experience

faq.question: Why does my interactive node execute twice?
faq.answer: This is normal behavior. First execution returns the interactive request, second processes user input. Ensure you set node.isEntry = false on second execution.

faq.question: How do I support multiple languages?
faq.answer: Add translation keys to all language files in packages/web/i18n/ including zh-CN, en, and zh-Hant directories.

faq.question: Can I chain multiple interactive nodes together?
faq.answer: Yes, each interactive node will pause the workflow independently. Users complete one before proceeding to the next.

faq.question: What files must I modify for a new interactive node?
faq.answer: At minimum: type definitions, dispatch logic, constants registration, isEntry whitelist, and frontend components.

faq.question: How do I handle complex user input validation?
faq.answer: Implement validation in the dispatch function before processing, return errors through the interactive response if validation fails.

faq.question: What's the difference between userSelect and formInput nodes?
faq.answer: userSelect presents single-choice options, formInput handles multiple input fields with various types and validation rules.
